intro: Viola tricolor var. segetalis, commonly known as the garden violet or the three-color violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive three-color pattern on its petals—typically purple, yellow, and white. The plant produces small, showy flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and prefers partial to full shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
